etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Edward Phillips (b. 1630), writer and biographer. From post-classical Latin recalcitration-, recalcitratio action of kicking out or backwards, insubordination, disobedience from classical Latin recalcitrāt-, past participial stem of recalcitrāre + -iō; compare -ation

definitions: The action of recalcitrate; an instance of this.
